channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Orbbec touts Pulsar ME450 as a multi-pattern 3D lidar
item.description: Orbbec says its Pulsar ME450 sensor can switch scanning modes so that robots don't need to switch between devices for navigation or 3D reconstruction....

item.title: The Download: GPT-5 is here, and Intel’s CEO drama
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. GPT-5 is her...

item.title: ‘Stagflation is coming to the U.S.,’ says this economist. Here’s what it means for the dollar, bonds and stocks.
item.description: The greenback faces a Wile E. Coyote moment says Savvas Savouri

item.title: Wendy’s cuts profit outlook as U.S. sales stay weak. Its stock is rising.
item.description: CEO Ken Cook said the company has “more work to do” to improve its U.S. business, which saw sales fall for a second straight quarter.

item.title: Black Hat 2025: Why your AI tools are becoming the next insider threat
item.description: Black Hat 2025 delivered performance metrics from beta programs and agentic AI deployments, proving results are being delivered over hype.

item.title: Under Armour’s stock dives, as CEO doesn’t like what tariffs are doing to profits
item.description: Under Armour’s fiscal second quarter outlook fell below Wall Street’s expectations, and the company again did not provide full-year outlook.

item.title: Millions of student-loan borrowers have no idea how much they’re supposed to pay
item.description: Balances increasing, forgiveness paused — the “level of confusion is just crazy.”

item.title: Trade Desk’s stock may see its worst drop ever, and analysts wonder if Amazon is to blame
item.description: Some say newfound competition is pressuring Trade Desk’s growth, but the ad-tech company’s CEO says Amazon is limited because it competes against mark...

item.title: ChatGPT users dismayed as OpenAI pulls popular models GPT-4o, o3 and more — enterprise API remains (for now)
item.description: OpenAI has announced GPT-5 will replace all models on ChatGPT. Many users are mourning the workhorse model.

item.title: Unitree launches A2 quadruped equipped with front and rear lidar
item.description: Unitree said its latest A2 quadruped robot can tackle more rugged terrain with greater perception capabilities than its previous robots. The post Unit...

item.title: Can iRobot bounce back? Deep concerns overshadow $127M Q2
item.description: Things have gotten so bad that iRobot has suspended future financial guidance and opted not to host an earnings call for Q2. The post Can iRobot bounc...

item.title: OpenAI launches GPT-5, nano, mini and Pro — not AGI, but capable of generating ‘software-on-demand’
item.description: With safer design, more robust reasoning, expanded developer tooling, and broad user access, GPT-5 reflects a maturing AI ecosystem.

item.title: Lyft partners with Baidu to deploy autonomous vehicles in Europe
item.description: Lyft plans to deploy Baidu Apollo Go's RT6 robotaxis in Germany and the U.K. starting next year, pending regulatory approvals. The post Lyft partners ...

item.title: Amtenbrink deploys Teqram’s EasyGrinder to cut 1,500 parts a day
item.description: Amtenbrink said post-processing is a highly manual process involving four distinct steps with multiple handling operations. The post Amtenbrink deploy...

item.title: The greenhouse gases we’re not accounting for
item.description: In the spring of 2021, climate scientists were stumped. The global economy was just emerging from the covid-19 lockdowns, but for some reason the leve...

item.title: GPT-5 is here. Now what?
item.description: At long last, OpenAI has released GPT-5. The new system abandons the distinction between OpenAI’s flagship models and its o series of reasoning models...

item.title: The initial reactions to OpenAI’s landmark open source gpt-oss models are highly varied and mixed
item.description: The verdict, for now, is split. OpenAI’s gpt-oss models are a landmark in terms of licensing and accessibility.

item.title: New ‘persona vectors’ from Anthropic let you decode and direct an LLM’s personality
item.description: A new study from Anthropic introduces "persona vectors," a technique for developers to monitor, predict and control unwanted LLM behaviors.

item.title: Five ways that AI is learning to improve itself
